tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE MissingPersons (
  case_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  person_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  age INT,
  date_missing DATE,
  location VARCHAR(100),
  description TEXT,
  coordinator_name VARCHAR(50),
  coordinator_contact VARCHAR(20)
)

CREATE TABLE missing_persons (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    age INT,
    gender VARCHAR(10),
    reported_location VARCHAR(100),
    last_seen_location VARCHAR(100)
);

CREATE TABLE search_efforts (
    search_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    missing_person_id INT,
    search_date DATE,
    search_location VARCHAR(100),
    coordinator_name VARCHAR(50),
    FOREIGN KEY (missing_person_id) REFERENCES missing_persons(id)
);

CREATE TABLE MissingPersonsCases(
  case_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  person_name VARCHAR(50),
  age INT,
  missing_date DATE,
  location VARCHAR(100)
);

CREATE TABLE SearchEfforts(
  search_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  case_id INT,
  search_date DATE,
  search_location VARCHAR(100),
  search_team_lead VARCHAR(50)
);

CREATE TABLE GeographicalData(
  location_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  location_name VARCHAR(100),
  latitude DECIMAL(10, 6),
  longitude DECIMAL(10, 6),
  country VARCHAR(50)
);

CREATE TABLE MissingPersons (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    age INT,
    gender VARCHAR(10),
    last_seen_location VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    status VARCHAR(20)
);

CREATE TABLE SearchEfforts (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    date DATE,
    search_location VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    volunteer_id INT,
    result VARCHAR(50)
);

CREATE TABLE MissingPersonsCases (
 case_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
 person_name VARCHAR(50),
 age INT,
 gender VARCHAR(10),
 last_known_location VARCHAR(100)
);

CREATE TABLE SearchEfforts (
 search_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
 case_id INT,
 search_date TIMESTAMP,
 search_team_lead VARCHAR(50),
 search_results TEXT
);
